Estimate the boundary layer resistance

Source: R/energybalance_functions.R
boundary_layer_resistance.Rd

Estimate the boundary layer resistance

boundary_layer_resistance(T_a, e_s, e_a, elev, D, u = NA)

Arguments

T_a

air temperature (K)
e_s

saturation vapor pressure (kPa)
e_a

actual vapor pressure (kPa)
elev

elevation (m)
D

characteristic dimension (e.g., body diameter) (m), ##diameter = 0.0016*log(mass) + 0.0061 for mass(g) #empirical formula for salamander diameter, Riddell et al. 2017
u

is wind speed in m/s, if not provided assume free convection; if provided, use forced convection if appropriate

Value

boundary layer resistance (s cm^-1)

Details

This function allows you to estimate boundary layer resistance under free convection. Based on the function in Riddell et al. 2017. Source: Riddell EA. 2017. Physical calculations of resistance to water loss improve predictions of species range models. Ecological Monographs 87: 21-23.

See also

Other biophysical models: Free_or_forced_convection, Grashof_number_Gates, Grashof_number, Nu_from_Gr, Nu_from_Re, Nusselt_number, Prandtl_number, Qconduction_animal, Qconduction_substrate, Qconvection, Qemitted_thermal_radiation, Qevaporation, Qmetabolism_from_mass_temp, Qmetabolism_from_mass, Qnet_Gates, Qradiation_absorbed, Qthermal_radiation_absorbed, Reynolds_number, Tb_CampbellNorman, Tb_Fei, Tb_Gates, Tb_butterfly, Tb_grasshopper, Tb_lizard, Tb_salamander_humid, Tsoil, actual_vapor_pressure, external_resistance_to_water_vapor_transfer, heat_transfer_coefficient_approximation, heat_transfer_coefficient_simple, heat_transfer_coefficient, saturation_vapor_pressure, saturation_water_vapor_pressure

Examples

if (FALSE) {
boundary_layer_resistance(T_a=293, e_s=2.4, e_a=2.5, elev=500, D=0.007, u=2)
}
